elements.title: Bhicoo Batlivala (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1943, Bhicoo Batlivala (pictured) led a group of Indian women to the House of Commons to request the release of Gandhi from prison?

elements.title: Columbia Lectures in International Studies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that WNEW-TV Channel 5 used its early-morning Columbia Lectures in International Studies to offset criticism of its prime-time schedule of crime show reruns?

elements.title: Moses Judah Hays (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Moses Judah Hays leased a block of buildings to the Canadian Parliament after its seat was burned down in 1849?

elements.title: its presence there (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that though Haiti did not compete at the 1936 Summer Olympics, its presence there made Liechtenstein change its flag?

elements.title: Imperial Bedroom (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Robert Downey Jr. declared Elvis Costello's Imperial Bedroom his favorite album in a 2005 article for Uncut magazine?

elements.title: a Detroit TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that datacasting tests by a Detroit TV station included a ceremonial broadcast of an early automobile patent from 1886?

elements.title: Madeleine Swann (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Madeleine Swann's name is a tribute to Marcel Proust?

elements.title: Michael H. v. Gerald D. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to Ruth Marcus, the facts of Michael H. v. Gerald D. "more closely resembled a soap opera synopsis than a typical Supreme Court case"?
